page.title: 02N.E.Wolverhampton: Landscape
page.content: The area forms part of the border of rural Staffordshire and the industrial West Midlands.It consists of a slope descending from east to west cut by a ridge running N/S, peaking at Bushbury Hill.There's an easily definable border between urban/rural land use.Industry's concentrated on the southern edge.The area has a dense road network of major and minor roads.A railway & canal also move through the area.Change has been immense in the past 35 years,composed mainly of expansion of the suburbs of Wolverhampton into former farmland and the enveloping of the large village of Wednesfield. The area is well provided with schools and local shopping centres of varying thresholds. There is also a hospital,fire station & police station. The area is composed mainly of the overspill of the town of Wolverhampton into retreating farmland.
